channel.title: nyc on Tolar Town
channel.description: Recent content in nyc on Tolar Town

item.title: The New York Easter Parade lives on!
item.description: Every Easter Sunday on 5th Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, outside St Patrick’s Cathedral, there is an Easter Parade. It’s bananas. You see everything from traditional Easter bonnets to outlandish performance art projects to political statements. This being a pandemic year, they couldn’t have the traditional gathering, so one group put together a Zoom call, complete with multiple rooms, dance parties with various styles of music, and a promenade, where folks could virtually “raise their hand” to show off their outfits.

item.title: Life in New York under PAUSE
item.description: It has been 4 weeks since Governor Andrew Cuomo shut down non-essential businesses in New York. He would later expand it to the New York PAUSE, similar to many other governmental policies called lockdown, shelter-in-place, and the like. The new normal has become wearing masks & gloves during the rare times I leave my apartment: to Foodtown, BQE Liquor & Wines, Meathook, or for a walk around the neighborhood, trying my best to avoid the swarms of people in parks or huddled around the newly minted takeout windows at bars & pizzerias.

item.title: Leaving NYC
item.description: I checked out from the TWA hotel and took off from NYC, off to California for a few days! Checking out of the TWA hotel Delta airplane to California

item.title: A night at the TWA Hotel
item.description: Before leaving town, I spent the night at the new TWA Hotel at JFK airport, where I enjoyed the Sunken Bar & the Connie bar, which is pretty neat in that it’s inside an actual vintage airplane. A hallway at TWA The Sunken Bar Martini at the Sunken Bar The outside of the Connie bar The airstrip outside the hotel. Inside the Connie bar

item.title: Last day in Brooklyn
item.description: Today, I had lunch at Allswell in Williamsburg, and then walked up to see the Kaws sculpture in Greenpoint, before heading over to Manhattan to pick up some currency ahead of my trip. Allswell, Williamsburg the kaws sculpture

item.title: Union Square Cafe
item.description: Today, I had lunch at one of my favorite spots, Union Square Cafe. Beforehand, I walked past the New York City Columbus Day Parade, and took a few photos. union square cafe a marching band at the parade a float getting ready for the parade
